info.name: Server-to-Server with Web SDK
info.description: SafeCharge offers a server-to-server integration to accept payments. This section describes the step-by-step flow of the best way to perform a server to server integration with SafeCharge, including using our Web SDK authenticate3d method to first perform a 3D Secure only validation.

exec: return yy + mm + dd + hh + MM + ss;
return json.clientRequestId !== undefined && json.clientRequestId !== "{{clientRequestId}}" ? json.clientRequestId : new Date().timestamp();
var hash; // this variable is for debuging purposes
tests["Returned  response code is \"" + responseCode + "\""] = responseCode === 200;
tests["Returned sessionToken is \"" + json.sessionToken + "\""] = json.sessionToken !== undefined;

request.description: run this script once, the "pre-req." script will prepare all the necessary calculation, such as the checksum

exec: // Checksum must be calculated at the end.

request.description:
This API retrieves the sessionToken you require for the Web SDK functions.
- Make sure to set you merchantId, merchantSiteId and secret in the environment variables
- you can view the checksum calculation in the "pre-req." tab. in case you get an "invalid checksum" response - make sure your secret key is set correctly with the environment variables
- compy the sessionToken from the response and place it in your Web SDK code.

exec: // Checksum must be calculated at the end.

request.description:
The call to authenticate3d() in the previous step returns the 3D Secure authentication output, and when authentication is successful you will receive:

eci equals either 5 or 2
The cavv value – the encrypted authentication value to pass on with the payment.
You can then proceed to perform a liability shift payment by calling the /payment API method, using the 3D Secure authentication fields as received from authenticate3d():

* cavv
* eci
* dsTransID (needed and retrieved only in case of 3Dv2)
These are placed under the externalMpi block under the threeD block, as illustrated in the sample below

exec: // Checksum must be calculated at the end.

request.description:
Use this method to process a regular/non-3D payment. This is in case that the the 3D Secure authenticate failed, and you would like to make the payment, nevertheless and WITHOUT LIABILITY-SHIFT:
when authenticate3d() returned eci=7,6,1; cavv is empty or null.
